name: Venezuela
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: While in recent years the relationship between Venezuela and the PRC has often been regarded as stangnant due to the slowdown in trade between both countries, China Index data suggests instead that the bilateral model has transitioned from an economic-led one to a more comprehensive model, involving increasing interactions in other fields such as Academia, Domestics Politics and Foreign Policy.

The most recent visit to Beijing made by the Venezuelan head of state Nicolás Maduro produced plenty of public information, allowing more evidence-backed responses to Indicators. In the last Index exercise in 2021 this was not the case. As a result, bilateral events have lifted Venezuela's score in the China Index.

New developments on the Media front, new information about the close ties between TV Channel CGTN and the Venezuelan-based Telesur were observed. Recently, TV programs and other contents made by CGTN have been deployed in Venezuela.
description-1: In 2023, Venezuela had a GDP per capita of US$2,157 and a total population of 28.84 million people.
description-2: Venezuela established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1974. Venezuela was ranked 156th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 15/100.

Media.evidence: I found information in the World Chinese Media website about different venezuelan branch media related to this organization. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: During 2023, I just can find information about one trip made by a venezuelan journalist called Aliana Abadi to Tangshan Province. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "few" rating. At the same time, it is a huge probablity this trip was paid by a PRC-connected entity. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: Despite I could not find information about trainings made by PRC state-owned media or PRC- connected entities to venezuelan journalists or online influencers, I found information about a training made in june 2023 by the Journalism School from Renmin University to 55 journalists from 45 different countries in the world. To this amount, 8 came from Latin America, but I could not confirm wheter one these came from Venezuela.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Since several years ago, CGTN have been producing a TV series with venezuelan based channel TelesurTV. So, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. At the same time, Telesur is a very important source of information use by the Venezuelan government like a propaganda tool. For that reason, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: The majority of TV owners in Venezuela doesn´t have business in the PRC. Maybe we can consider interests that have some venezuelan public media, but they are managed or controled by the Governent.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: As I said in the indicator "5" of this domain, CGTN channel have an agreement with Venezuelan-based TelesurTv to delivered a program called "Prisma" which is focused on create cultural docummentaries. Therefor, this indicator deserves a "few, significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: During the last official visit made by Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan Head of State, to the PRC, public TV Media like Telesur and Venezolana de Televisión used to describe the bilateral relationship with words like "brotherhood" "strong and unbreakable brotherhood". Also, they media use some words like "south-south cooperation". Therefroe, this indicator deserves a "More than few, significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Since 2022, the Chinese- Venezuelan parliamentary friendship group has been established. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Since several years ago, Venezuela have received donations from the PRC. These donations have been directed to Healthy sector (vaccines during Covid pandemic), financial sector or to finance training for public officials. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is information about different kind of trainings made by PRC institutions to public officials in Venezuela. For example, during 2009 the PRC National School of Management applied trainings to venezuelan officials belonged to Minister of Planning and Development. Also, during 2014 the Ministry of Foreign Affairs agreed with the PRC government a program to training high level officials. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.note: I reviewed some websites which published information about CCICED recent activities or events. None of these show information about any Venezuelan official who have taken part in any CCICED events.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During his last official visit to the PRC, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro agreed with his counterpart to elevate the Strategic Comprehensive Partnership (signed in 2014) to a new "All-Weather Strategic Partnership" (signed in September 2023). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During his last visit, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro appointed publicly his support to the "one China principle". Moreover, in March 2023, Maduro said his country will be in "the front line" to defend the "one China principle". Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2016, the former Venezuelan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Delcy Rodíguez (today she is the vice president of this country) supported the PRC’s claim to the South China Sea. Therefore, the Index country has adhered to the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2022, Venezuela´s ambassador to the UN supported in the UN Human Rights Council an appointment wrote by the Pakistan delegation which opposed ‘interference in China’s internal affairs, among then the Xinjiang´s policy . Therefore, the Index country has voiced support for the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2022, Venezuela´s ambassador to the UN supported in the UN Human Rights Council an appointment wrote by the Pakistan delegation which opposed ‘interference in China’s internal affairs, among thwn the chinese policy toward Tibet. Also, during August 2023, Venezuelan diplomatic officials visited Tibet region after chinese Government invited them to know it. Therefore, I can confirm Venezuela has supported the PRC policy toward Tibet. So this indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2020, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Venezuela released an official statement supporting the approval of Hong Kong Security Law. Therefore, the Index country has voiced support for the PRC’s ongoing repression in Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The only reference that could be found was a partnership between Huawei and the Simón Bolívar University during 2015. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. At the same time, this partnership was to build a solar power prototype. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "insignificant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is evidence about the existence of only one Confucius Institute in Venezuela located at Bolivarian University of Venezuela. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. For its part, the Bolivarian University is one of the most sponsored and financied by the Venezuelan government. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: Despite there is no evidence about inclusion of chinese language in primary education in Venezuela, it can be confirmed that there's interest to deep cooperation in the education field between both countries after a meeting celebrated between ambassador in Caracas Lan Hu and  the Bolivarian University rector, Sandra Oblitas.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is evidence about the strong relationship between a Venezuelan think tank based in Beijing called "Centro Venezolano de Estudios sobre China" (Venezuelan Center of Studies on China) and the Communication University of China (CUC). These entities have published in 2023 a book called "China and Venezuela: Toward a share future". Also, this venezuelan research center participated in a recent event sponsored by the CUC. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Recently, a venezuelan think tank called "Venezuelan Center of Studies on China" (CVEC, in spanish) was awarded by the Communication University of China (CUC). At the same time, in March 2023, CVEC published a book related to China-Venezuela Relationship. This book was sponsored by CUC. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.https://cvechina.org/comunidad-de-futuro-compartido/12843/
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Since almost 15 years ago, Venezuela and China have an agreement to grant scholarships in the PRC to venezuelan scholars. These trips (and other expenses) was paid by the PRC governement. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: The only interest to deep cooperation in the education field was a meeting celebrated between ambassador in Caracas Lan Hu and  the Ministry of University Education, Sandra Oblitas in october 2023. Beyond that, there is no evidence of this indicator phenomenom.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: After a review throughout some Venezuelan academic institutions and their publications. None of them have written anything about Human Rights abuses (neither in favor nor in opposition) in the PRC.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There's information about the signing of some agreements between Venezuelan provinces and the PRC provinces, but in the majority of cases they have been just memorandum of understanding related to friendship relationships. Economic agreements were signed directly between both national governments from the PRC and Venezuela. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is evidence that demonstrates the singing of the bonds of brotherhood between the PRC provinces and the Venezuelan provinces. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenom
Domestic Politics.note: No information was found related to trips paid by entities linked to the PRC during the last year. Beyond that, evidence was found showing some trips paid by the PRC government to a Venezuelan politician or official.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Recently, Rafael Lacava, head of Carabobo Province in Venezuela, visited Shanghái representing the Venezuelan government. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In March 2023, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro was invited by the Chinese Comunist Party (CCP) to take part in Dialogue with World Political Parties High-level Meeting. Also, in october a delegation from the venezuelan ruling party visited the PRC and had some meetings with high level officials from CCP. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Mora than a few, significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenom
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Although the existence of some UFWD-affiliated groups in Venezuela can be confirmed, it is difficult to confirm whether they have provided any support to Venezuelan officials, politicians or parties. Therefore, the phenomenon of the Indicator has not been observed.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenom
Domestic Politics.note: It is very difficult to find some kind of critics, harras or threat made by PRC officials agaisnt any politician (including opposition leaders) in Venezuela. PRC officials  used to be assertive implementing its foreign policy toward Venezuela. In this sense, PRC officials use the "no interference in internal affairs" principle to maintain some kind of neutrality in venezuelan politial environment.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is evidence about speeches or statements made by some influential politicians in Venezuela related to tha advantages and/or succesful of the PRC model. Among these people are the son of the president Nicolás Maduro and Rafael Lacava, governor from Carabobo province, who is a close ally to Maduro. So, these people have echoed prc talking points. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenom
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: During the last visit made by the Venezuelan president to the PRC, some rulling party officials like Diosdado Cabello made an appointment against former opposition presidential candidate Henrique Capriles due to his critics about Maduro´s travel to Beijing. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: According to the data publish by the National Statistical Bureau of China, this country had a trade balance with Venezuela above 3 billion USD. Verifying this figure with information show in the World Integrated Trade Solution (WITS) from the World Bank, this Asian country was the Venezuela´s main trading partner in 2022 (there is no data updated for 2023). Therefore, this indicatior deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Despite it is difficult to find information, there are some estimates that show the bilateral debt between China and Venezuela is around 11 and 16 billion US$. Last forecasts made by independent researchers and organizations like Transparencia Venezuela come from 2021 and 2022. For 2023 it was impossible to add new information. But taking into account the existence evidence, we can confirm that the chinese financial entities own more than 25% of Venezuela´s bilateral sovereign debt. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The main customer in 2023 for Venezuela´s extractive industries is the United States. Therefore, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.note: The main extractive industry in Venezuela is the oil industry. In this sense, it is important to note Venezuela have been increasing its oil exports to the US after the Biden´s Administration eased oil sanctions against this country. So, from the end of 2022 to now its possible to confirm an important grow in american´s purchases of venezuelan oil. At the same time, the US government lifted- in october 2023- restrictions to foreing companies to invest in the Venezuelan oil sector. This could permit chinese company CNPC start new investments or oil purchases (CNPC did not buy venezuelan oil during 2023). Then I confirm the US is the top customer for Venezuela´s extractive industries.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is information on Chinese influence (or control) in two sensitive sectors such as Oil and National Security. In the first case, the PRC and Venezuela have three joint ventures operating in the Orinoco Oil Belt and in the western oil basins of the country, respectively. In the second case, CIEC installed a digital surveillance system in Venezuela. At present, it is known that CIEC maintains its support to the Venezuelan government to manage this surveillance system. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.note: Although relevant information was found on some sensitive sectors managed by PRC companies, the same was not true for critical infrastructures such as ports, etc.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In 2017 Venezuelan governement approved to apply as a member of this bank. Since then, Venezuela has not been conformed as an official member. Now, acoording to the AIIB´s website Venezuela is a "prospective member". Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Information on direct and indirect participants was reviewed on the official website of the China Interbank Cross-Border Interbank Payment System (CIPS). Thus, no information was found on any Venezuelan financial institution that is part of this system. Therefore, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Economy.note: Despite Venezuela is not using CIPS system, there are some key factors that let us think this situation could change in the next future. These reasons could be the following: 1) In 2018, presidents from the Venezuelan Central Bank and the People´s Bank of China signed a cooperation agreement, 2) In 2019, president Nicolás Maduro announced his intention to use new international payments systems to bypass the US financial sanctions against his government, 3) Recently, Venezuela announced the adoption of the Russian "MIR" payments system, and 4) Maduro´s government has the serious intention to promote politics that switch the use of the US dollars by other currencies like Russian rubbles or Chinese Renmimbi.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon. Instead, the PRC and Venezuelan have the intention to deep their economic cooperation.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Despite the important bilateral cooperation in economic fields between both countries, there is no observation or evidence about any intention to sign a Free Trade Agreement.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In his most recent visit to the PRC, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro signed some Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) woth chinese officials to promote cooperation in three Special Economic Zones (SEZ) in Venezuela. Also, Venezuelan government has created a legal framework to attract foreign direct investent to its SEZ. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In may 2023, Venezuela and the PRC had some discussions to reestructurate the Venezuela´s debts. This information was published off-the-record by Reuters, but it was impossible to certificate officially. Beyond this, in 2018 both countries agreed the transfer os 9.9% of Sinovensa Joint venrture stakes in favour of China. In that moment, that transfer was considered as a collateral payment made by Maduro´s government, which recieved a "grace period" to defer service debt payments.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: After reviewing information about agreements signed by China anda Venezuela since 2000 until now, it can be confirmed that none of companies cited in the indicator have presence in Venezuela. Therefore, there is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Since last decade the Venezuelan government has signed different agreements with Huawei and ZTE to sell their 4G products. For example, in 2015 Huawei started to offer in the Venezuelan market its router "Multibam 4G LTE". After that, president Nicolás Maduro signed new agreements to establish- through Stated-owned telecom company Molvinet-  a 4G technology called "Long Term Evolution" produced by Huawei and ZTE. In 2019, Maduro continued with his intention to engage and promote new investments from Huawei. Finally, in 2023, the president of Movilnet appointed that his company brings back Huwaei cellphones to the Venezuelan market. Therefore this indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2015 the state-owned company Movilnet provided as part of its portfolio a router called “Multibam 4G LTE”. This router is produced by Huawei Technologies. Recently, during the last visit of President Nicolas Maduro to the People's Republic of China, both countries signed a memorandum of understanding to increase cooperation between Venezuelan public telecommunications companies (Movilnet and CANTV) and Huawei. Unfortunately, there was no further information on the content of these agreements. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: No information was found on the use of Chinese technology in ports, airports, public transportation or governmental computer networks in Venezuela. This does not mean the existence of barriers or prohibitions to public companies in the country to buy this type of technology from companies such as Huawei or ZTE. Beyond this, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.note: A link was added regarding Venezuela's participation in the 14th International Infrastructure Investment and Construction Forum. In this meeting, the Venezuelan Minister of Transport, Ramón Velásquez indicated his country's interest in attracting Chinese investments to improve some ports and/or airports in Venezuela.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2017 the PRC firm ZTE signed a contract with the Venezuelan government to build a system that monitors citizen behavior through an identification card called "fatherland card". This card permits collection of personal data and biometric information. At the same time, the Venezuelan government build a camera system to surveil venezuelan people in 16 provinces. This last project was developed between the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Venezuela and CIEC. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.note: The Chinese Venezuelan relationship have been developed throug a model based on State-Stae relations. So, It is no common the developing of some investments in local technology start-ups.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2008, the National Company os Telecommunications of Venezuela, CANTV, signed a contract with ZTE to collaborate in the development of an IPTV project. According to ZTE´s website this project consists in provide "the Head End, Content Delivery Network (CDN), Middleware, Conditional Access/Digital Rights Management (CA/DRM) System, Set-Top Box (STB), and Network Management System (NMS)". Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In 2008 and 2012, Venezuelan government launched- with the support of China Great Wall Industry Corporation- two satellites to the space. Also, In 2023, both countries agreed the participation of the Venezuelan side in the International Lunar Research Station (ILRS) cooperation project. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: In October 2022, Venezuela requested to China Siwei Surveying and Mapping Technology Co. Ltd. (a subsidiary of China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation) support to identify potential deaths and/or other kind of material losses due to a natural disaster suffered in central localtion of Tejerías. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is evidence about an organization called " Asociación para la Promoción de la Reunificación Pacífica de China en Venezuela (Veneuzelan Asociation for the Promotion of Chinese Peaceful Reunification". This organization has been working since at least 2007, but also had a meeting in May 2023 with the current Ambassador in Caracas, Lan Hu. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few, significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is evidence about the existence of one organization called "Federación de Chinos de Ultramar en Venezuela" (Federation of Overseas Chinese People in Venezuela). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: References were found to two meetings held in May and November 2007, respectively, between members of the All-China Federation of Trade Unions and Venezuelan trade union leaders. One was held in Beijing and the other in Caracas. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Information was found on the New Moon Party by the Federation of Overseas Chinese in Venezuela. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, but significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is evidence about the existence of an organization called "Federación China de Círculos Literarios y Artísticos de Venezuela" (China Federation of Literary and Art Circles of Venezuela). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: CANTV, the main telecommunications company of Venezuela, has- as a part of its open tv channels offer- CGTN in spanish. Moreover, the State-owned TV channel Telesur produce an entertainment tv program called "Espejo de palabras" (Word´s mirror). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: According to a poll made by the main newspaper in Venezuela, Últimas Noticias, about 45% of venezuelan people use TikTok. Therefore, this indicator dserves a "Yes" response.
Society.note: This poll was made online. For this reason its results could not be the most accuracy information, but for this China Index interaction UN poll was the only source that I could find to response this Indicator. In any case, the confidence rating is 60%.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In november 2023, the PRC Embassy in Venezuela coorganized "The Chinese Cultutral week" with the Venezuelan Association of Chinese Studies from Los Andes University (ULA, in spanish). The headquarters of ULA are in Mérida City (western of Venezuela) and the former Minister-Counselor of Chinese Embassy in Caracas, Zhang Yuanwei (张元伟) visited this city during the event. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few, significant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The 2023 version of Latinobarométro poll revealed about 52,9% of Venezuelan people have favorable views toward the PRC. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: The most recent report related to the imports or donations of military equipment made by the PRC to Venezuela shows during 2017-2021 period the Asian country was one of the most important suplliers to Caracas government. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Military.note: Despite the relevance of some purchases made by Venezuela from the PRC, the most important supplier for this south american country is Russia.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: According to a press release published by the Ministry of Defense of Argentina, a Venezuelan delegation took part of The Fifth Forum China- Latin America and the Carribbean. This event was in december 2022. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Military.note: Venezuela has been purchasing chinese miliatry or law enforcement equipment. Despite both countries have signed technology tranfers in this field, none of this agreements had brought vo-developing activities between both countries.

Military.evidence: Despite the good military cooperation between China and Venezuela, the PRC authorities have not expressed any intention to establish a miliatry base in Venezuela. For that reason, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Despite both countries have not signed an Extradition Treaty yet, there are a lot a evidence that prove cooperation between China and Venezuela in their Law systems. Recently, in november 2023, the Head of the Venezuelan Supreme Court, Gladys Gutierrez, had a meeting with the Head of Shanghai Court, Jia Yu. In that moment, both Gutierrez and Yu, signed a Memorandum of Understanding in judicial cooperation. After this, Gutierrez also traveled to Fujian city to be part of Maritime Silk Road (Quanzhou) International Forum on Judicial Cooperation. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
